intro: Bothriopodium glaziovii var. robustius, commonly known as the robust spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. It has slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often clustered at the base. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking native, hardy plants.
